ROW.description: List available source(s) for other known position(s)
List chronologically the instruments collecting the ancillary position(s)
List chronologically the datetime (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss) for ancillary position(s)
List chronologically the longitude for ancillary position(s)
List chronologically the latitude for ancillary position(s)
List chronologically the quality (location class/ accuracy/ range etc.) for ancillary position(s). Can be qualitative.
Description of condition/ injury. Or specify scoring system and a score.
Length of the animal
Method used to obtain the measurement
ROW.exampleValues: measured caliper, measured tape, estimated, calculated

ROW.description: Type of length measurement
ROW.exampleValues: Curved fork length, Straight fork length, total length. for turtle the standard measurements are Curved Carapace Length (CCL), Straight Carapace Length (SCL), Curved Carapace Width (CCW) and Straight Carapace Width (SCW), and researchers occasionally me

ROW.description: Unit of length measurement
Common name(s) or FAO code for species name
Taxononomic Serial Number (TSN) from Integrated Taxonomic Information System
Description of condition/ injury. Or specify scoring system and a score.
Fate of the animal upon recapture
ROW.exampleValues: harvested, released, tag and release, missing, unknown; observed/ photo ID

ROW.description: Method used to obtain the measurement
ROW.exampleValues: measured Caliper, measured tape, estimated, calculated

ROW.description: Length of the animal
Type of length measurement
Unit of length measurement
Life stage of the animal
Life stage of the animal
Description of where the tag was placed.
Age from direct aging methods if available
If caught on longline, specify soak time In hours
If caught on longline, specify soak time In hours
Number of suture used to close the wound
If caught on rod and wheel or handline, specify fight time
If caught on rod and wheel or handline, specify fight time
Time used (minutes) in carrying out the attachment or surgical procedure.
If the animal is revived, specify revival time in minutes
Number of bolts used for mounting
Sex of the animal
Stock origin if known
List other sample types and sample IDs if collected
List other sample types and sample IDs if collected
Weight of the animal
Method used to obtain the measurement
Method used to obtain the measurement
Weight of the animal
Type of weight measurement
Type of weight measurement
Unit of weight measurement
Unit of weight measurement
Material of anchor
Type of anchor
Brand name and/ product for attachment materials used
Type of mount
Method to get a tag detached from the animal/ anchor
ROW.exampleValues: corrosive burn wire, oxidative/ explosive, galavanizing metal, acoustic release

ROW.description: Materials and methods in constructing a tether
End to end length (centimeter) of a tether
Tether material for a towed tag
Brand name and/ product of anesthesia used during the attachment
Brand name and/ product of antifoluling paint or coating applied
Brand name and/ product of antiseptic or sterilizing agent used during the attachment
Specify any additional floation used
If a mechanical release is engaged at depth (too avoid crushing the tag), specify the mechanism and depth at which the release is engaged.
Method used to put the tag on/ in the animal
ROW.exampleValues: tow, glue, suction, anchor, mount, implant, harness, backpack

ROW.description: How deep (centimeter) should the anchor be in the animal?
Dimensions (millimeter) as length, width, thichkness or diameter.
Latitude (decimal degree) of release/ deployment
Longitude (decimal degree) of release/ deployment
Person responsible for tagging or surgery
Local date time (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss) of release/ deployment
Name or standard identifer of location
Type of gear used to catch the animal
ROW.exampleValues: Longline, purse seine, troll, trawl, rod and reel, handline, set net, trap, gillnet, harpoon, hoop net, anesthesia, tangle net, dip net, vertical line entanglement (commercial fisheries, aquaculture, mooring), dredge, pound net/weir (for turtles)

ROW.description: Bait, chum, lure or decoy used
Name or standard identifer of cruise
Depth (meters) at which the animal was caught
The vessel’s country of registration
Type of hook used
how was animal put aboard the vessel
List tag IDs for conventional, acoustic, PIT, band or satellite tags for multi-tagged situation, photoID, photo/video footage file names
Person responsible for angling
Type of school in which the animal was caught
ROW.exampleValues: Free school, log, anchored FAD, drifting FAD

ROW.description: World Meteorological Organization sea state code (0-9)
If caught on longline, include set number and float number
Name or standard identifer of station
Air or sea surface temperature (Celcius) when the animal was caught
Name or standard identifer of vessel
Wind speed (knots) when the animal was caught
End date time (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss) or date range (BETWEEN yyyy-mm-dd AND yyyy-mm-dd) if estimated/ guessed.
Description of end point
ROW.exampleValues: GPS, Argos, estimated, calculated, modeled, recovered on animal, floater at sea, animal died and sank, recovered on land, recovered by fishing fleet, recovered in port, transfer in transshipment, found in well number X, recovered in processing plant

ROW.description: Description of how the end point is derived for the device.
ROW.exampleValues: first reported, recaptured, last transmission, recovered

ROW.description: End latitude
End longitude
Argos location class for popup location or satellite transmission
If mortality occurs before end datetime, specify date time (yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss)
Append an identifer that is unique within your organization. This is essential if a device is recycled.
Type of instrument
ROW.exampleValues: archival, popup, satellite, acoustic tag, or acoustic receiver

ROW.description: Version number of the firmware used to build the device
Name of manufacturer
ROW.exampleValues: Wildlife Computers, Microwave Telemetry, Lotek Wireless, Desert Star Systems, CEFAS, StarOddi, Sea Mammal Research Unit, Vemco, Loggerhead Instruments, Biologging Solutions, Little Leonardo, Teleonics etc.

ROW.description: Model name
Contact email/ telephone/ address
Researcher/ organization owning the device
Serial number
Date (yyyy-mm-dd) of receiving the device from manufacturer
Name or identifer for project/ grant number
Platform Transmitting Terminal (PTT) number for Argos transmission.
PTT in hexadecimal
Specification document name/ URL/ file (e.g., in xml)
Placeholder for acoustic tags
Placeholder for acoustic tags
File/ URL to a report listing the details of programming
Programming software with version number
Days at a constant depth before release is initiated
Programmed mission length in days
Interval in minutes during when data are summarized for that period
Person responsible for the programming
Sampling rate (seconds) for sensor sampling
Time interval in seconds when sampled data are written to onboard storage memory
Sampling rate (seconds) for sensor sampling at a higher frequency
Is there any problem found in this dataset? One of 3 responses: yes, no, unexamined.
Person responsible for quality control
Date range (BETWEEN yyyy-mm-dd AND yyyy-mm-dd) in which data quality is in doubt
Provide details for the problem(s)
ROW.exampleValues: Daily drift after sunset by 1.5 degC

ROW.description: Number of problems found
List short description(s) for the problem(s)
Files/ URLs used for calibration of sensors
Name or standard identifer of location
Type of gear used to catch the animal
ROW.exampleValues: Longline, purse seine, troll, trawl, rod and reel, handline, set net, trap, gillnet, harpoon, hoop net, anesthesia, tangle net, dip net, vertical line entanglement (commercial fisheries, aquaculture, mooring), dredge, pound net/weir (for turtles)

ROW.description: Person responsible for the recapture
Bait, chum, lure or decoy used
Name or standard identifer of cruise
Depth (meters) at which the animal was caught
The vessel’s country of registration
Type of hook used
Person responsible for tag-and-release
List tag IDs for conventional, acoustic, PIT, band or satellite tags for multi-tagged situation, photoID, photo/video footage file names
Type of school in which the animal was caught
ROW.exampleValues: Free school, log, anchored FAD, drifting FAD

ROW.description: World Meteorological Organization sea state code (0-9)
If caught on longline, include set number and float number
Name or standard identifer of station
Air or sea surface temperature (Celcius) when the animal was caught
Name or standard identifer of vessel
Wind speed (knots) when the animal was caught
State the source for waypoints
ROW.exampleValues: Argos, GPS, acoustic detections, manufacturer, modeled

ROW.description: List of Geocorrection Parameters and associated values implemented. Comma seperated list in format 'parameter1:value', 'parameter2:value',..
None if no interpolation. Otherwise, specify method/ software used.
ROW.exampleValues: None, crawl, Bézier curves, Hermite splines and cubic splines

ROW.description: Specify the time interval for interpolation
If "waypoints_source" = "modeled", specify the method used to estimate the positions. Include citation/ reference/ url if available
ROW.exampleValues: kftrack, ukfsst, trackit, tripEstimation, SSM, GPE3, Track & Loc, GeoLight, BASTrack, IKNOS

ROW.description: Software packages used with version number
URL/URI to any relevant geocorrection output file(s) produced
